text: Hey dude,sorry had a wild week, deadline combined with a first WFH week :slightly_smiling_face:  So, lighting wise, did you make and HDRI for the set?
Do you have any macbetch from there or any form of grey?

for such shots, where lighting is super flat, it's a really good idea to shoot some reference for the shadows at least, because at the moment (shot on the bridge) it's really hard to evaluate what's going on, plus we don't know the materials of robot

in the shot where we see it from the back it's a bit easier - just make that railing in 3d, with approximate colors/spec and match, that will make your life easier. Also try to use 2-3 sources at most(HDRI included)

Yes it's lit with just a HDRI for each shot that we took on set :+1: Yes my compositor has all the reference we took but Macbeth was the one thing we forgot to shoot for the wall shot :upside_down_face: we have one for the bridge shot though. I've rendered it with all the AOVs that comp has asked for and he's currently working with the first few frames. I've made the wall and railing in 3D with a aishadowmatte on to catch the shadows but for the railing, he said he wanted to challenge himself in comp by doing the reflection manually :slightly_smiling_face:
